title: Define UI state machine and view modes
description:
Define the state machine for the adaptive UI:

**View Modes:**
1. `idle` - No logo exists, chat is prominent, welcome state
2. `generating` - AI is creating logo, loading state with progress
3. `reviewing` - Logo exists, preview dominant, chat as sidebar

**State Transitions:**
- idle → generating (user sends first message)
- generating → reviewing (logo generated)
- reviewing → generating (user requests changes)

**Deliverable:**
- TypeScript types for view modes
- State derivation logic based on svg/isLoading state
close_reason: Closed

title: Create Settings Drawer component
description:
Extract ConfigPanel into a slide-out drawer that's hidden by default.

**Design:**

- Triggered by floating gear button
- Contains all current ConfigPanel functionality
- Closes when clicking outside or pressing X
- Smooth animation (300ms ease-out)

**Purpose:**
- Settings are 'advanced' - most users just talk to AI
- Reduces visual clutter in default state
- Still accessible for power users who want manual control

**Philosophy Alignment:**
- Invisible Interface: Hide unless needed
- Progressive Disclosure: Reveal complexity on demand

title: Implement checkpoint and resume capability

title: Redesign Generator UI: Adaptive Layout Based on Philosophy
description:
Redesign the Logo Generator UI to reduce cognitive load and embrace the philosophy.md principles:

**Current Problems:**
- Three-panel layout (config, preview, chat) all visible at once - too crowded
- User forced to context-switch between panels constantly
- Settings panel demands attention even when not needed
- Not embracing the 'Editor Mindset' or 'Invisible Interface' principles

**Philosophy Principles to Apply:**
1. **Editor Mindset** - User reviews/approves AI work, not doing data entry
2. **Adaptive UX** - Interface transforms based on intent and context  
3. **Invisible Interface** - Surface only what's relevant to the current task
4. **Consent & Clarity** - AI proposes, user approves in collaborative loop

**Target State:**
- Chat-first experience for initial intent capture
- Preview dominant when reviewing generated logos
- Settings hidden by default, revealed contextually
- Progressive disclosure - start simple, reveal complexity as needed
- State-based layout that adapts: idle → generating → reviewing

title: Create svg-logo-creation.md skill definition
description:
Create .claude/skills/logo-design/SKILL.md (renamed from svg-logo-creation.md):

This skill file provides domain knowledge for logo design without tool-call overhead. Content:

## Design Principles
- Balance and visual weight
- Simplicity and scalability
- Typography best practices
- Color harmony
- Memorability

## Logo Types
- Wordmark, Lettermark, Abstract, Pictorial
- Mascot, Combination, Emblem

## Theme Presets
- Modern, Minimal, Bold, Elegant
- Playful, Tech, Vintage, Organic

## Shape Library
- Circle, Hexagon, Triangle, Diamond
- Star, Shield, Square, Pill

## Quality Standards
- Pass thresholds for each judge
- Iteration workflow guidance
- SVG best practices

## Production Requirements
- File size targets (<50KB ideal)
- Font embedding requirements
- Color format standards

Note: This replaces the MCP-based tool approach. The skill is loaded automatically when agent uses settingSources: ['user', 'project'].

title: Epic: Judge Subagents
description:
Implement the 4 logo evaluation judges as Claude Agent SDK Subagents instead of MCP tools. Each judge is a specialized AI evaluator with its own system prompt that can run in parallel.

Judges:
1. **Concept Fidelity** (weight: 35%) - Brand alignment, colors, typography, style
2. **Technical Quality** (weight: 25%) - SVG validity, optimization, accessibility
3. **Scalability** (weight: 15%) - Multi-size appearance (favicon to billboard)
4. **Production Readiness** (weight: 25%) - Export compatibility, fonts, file size

Pass thresholds:
- Concept Fidelity: >= 7.0
- Technical Quality: >= 8.0
- Scalability: >= 6.0
- Production Readiness: >= 7.5
- Overall: >= 7.0 with no critical issues

Each judge uses AgentDefinition and is spawned via Task tool for parallel execution.

title: Epic: MCP to Skills & Subagents Migration
description:
Architectural migration from MCP-based tools to Claude Agent SDK native Skills (SKILL.md files) and Subagents (AgentDefinition). This eliminates the createSdkMcpServer pattern in favor of:

1. **Skills**: Domain knowledge as SKILL.md files loaded at query time
2. **Subagents**: Specialized AI evaluators as programmatic AgentDefinition objects
3. **Direct Functions**: Pure TypeScript functions called directly (no MCP wrapper)

Benefits:
- Reduced token usage (skills provide context without tool-call overhead)
- Native parallelism for judge subagents
- Cleaner separation of knowledge vs execution
- Model flexibility per subagent
- Easier maintenance of SKILL.md vs code

Plan: plans/convert-mcp-tools-to-skills.md

title: Create frontend-design skill (judge)
description:
Create .claude/skills/design-judge/SKILL.md:

This skill provides the evaluation framework and criteria for the judge subagents. It's a reference skill that helps maintain consistency across all 4 judges.

Content:

## Evaluation Framework
- Scoring rubric (0-10 scale)
- Criterion structure (score, reasoning, issues, suggestions)
- Pass threshold guidelines

## Concept Fidelity Criteria
- Brand alignment evaluation
- Color accuracy assessment
- Typography matching
- Style consistency checks

## Technical Quality Criteria
- SVG validity requirements
- Optimization checklist
- Accessibility standards
- Dimension accuracy

## Scalability Criteria
- Size-specific evaluation (16px to billboard)
- Stroke scaling considerations
- Aspect ratio guidelines

## Production Readiness Criteria
- Export compatibility requirements
- Font availability checks
- Color format standards
- File size thresholds

## Aggregation Rules
- Weighted scoring (35/25/15/25)
- Critical issue handling
- Suggestion prioritization

This skill is used as reference context by all judge subagents.
close_reason: Merged into logoer-vprh (Create logo-design SKILL.md) which now includes design judge criteria as part of the comprehensive skill

title: Create production-readiness-judge subagent
description:
Create container-ts/src/agents/production-readiness-judge.ts:

AgentDefinition with:
- name: 'production_readiness_judge'
- description: 'Evaluates deployment readiness for web, print, and digital products'
- systemPrompt: Extract from tools/judges.ts PRODUCTION_READINESS_SYSTEM_PROMPT
- model: 'claude-sonnet-4-5'

Evaluation criteria (each 0-10):
1. rasterExportability - PNG/JPG export quality
2. fontAvailability - Web-safe or embedded fonts
3. colorFormat - Standard hex/rgb, print compatible
4. selfContainment - No external dependencies
5. fileSize - <50KB ideal, <100KB acceptable

Pass threshold: >= 7.5

title: Implement parallel judge aggregation
description:
Implement the aggregated judge execution pattern:

1. Main agent spawns 4 judge subagents via Task tool in parallel
2. Each judge returns structured SingleJudgeEvaluation
3. Aggregate using weighted average:
   - Concept Fidelity: 35%
   - Technical Quality: 25%
   - Scalability: 15%
   - Production Readiness: 25%

4. Determine overall pass/fail:
   - All individual judges must pass
   - No critical issues
   - Overall score >= 7.0

5. Return AggregatedEvaluation with:
   - passed: boolean
   - overallScore: number
   - judgeResults: array
   - criticalIssues: array
   - prioritizedSuggestions: array
   - failedJudges: array

title: Create technical-quality-judge subagent
description:
Create container-ts/src/agents/technical-quality-judge.ts:

AgentDefinition with:
- name: 'technical_quality_judge'
- description: 'Evaluates SVG validity, optimization, element usage, and accessibility'
- systemPrompt: Extract from tools/judges.ts TECHNICAL_QUALITY_SYSTEM_PROMPT
- model: 'claude-sonnet-4-5'

Evaluation criteria (each 0-10):
1. validity - Well-formed SVG with proper xmlns
2. optimization - Clean, minimal code
3. elementUsage - Appropriate SVG elements
4. accessibility - Contrast, alt text capability
5. dimensionAccuracy - Correct viewBox and positioning

Pass threshold: >= 8.0 (highest bar)
